review_text: Grump Bump! I saw the Game Grumps play this, and wanted to try it for myself. The art style is really cute, and the game play is challenging, but fun.  I usually don't like stealth games, but I enjoyed this one.

I am actually surprised they're not charging for this game.

Usually, when I see "student project" and "free" I'll usually pass it over.  Often times these free games perform very poorly and look kind of rubbish.  NOT THIS ONE.

The art style is consistent and terribly charming.  It's actually quite light-hearted, which masks the really dark undercurrent of the game:  you are playing a werewolf, who will easily, if not cheerfully, murder anybody who looks at him funny and then snarfle the corpse like a BBQ brochette.

That tension defines the game:  you're a janitor who, for corporate dystopian rules, is obliged to work at night while transformed.  Other workers are also there.  You need to still clean those messes, but you need to not be seen while doing it, so you become a stealth-janitor, skulking about, trying to avoid being seen so you don't have to silence witnesses (and then eat them to conceal the evidence).  The game will reward you with a tiny medal if you can get through an evening without murder, but... eh, who's going to miss an office drone or two, anyway?

I quite like a stealth game, and good ones have opponents who don't just walk around predictably in squares with convenient pauses - those games are geometry problems.  People here are more believable, meandering to do various tasks.  But, in a nod towards good UI in gameplay, a little timer appears over their head telling you how long you have before they do something else, which lets you decide if it's worth chancing going for that hallway, or waiting to see where that person goes next.

So, to recap:  the art style is remarkably cheerful, and apart from the excessively juicy transformation noise, it's not really gruesome either.  (Okay, consuming a corpse leaves big red splashes and what my wife would call "squiggly spooges" on the ground; they're more like pink corkscrews than internal organs).  If these guys actually tried to sell this game, I'd've actually bought it, and I can't think of any higher praise than that.  I don't even plan on pushing my gaming-adjacent stuff much at all here, that's how highly I hold this in regard.  (But do look at my profile if you'd be so kind.)

It's free, it's pretty good.  Can't beat that.  Give it a try.

[h1]Intro[/h1]
[i]The WereCleaner[/i] is a stealth game where you play as a janitor, cleaning messes in an office while trying to avoid being seen. The game has 7 levels in total.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- 7 levels
- Various mechanics to keep you entertained

[b]Cons:[/b]
- It can be hard to see people who are outside the screen that is looking in your direction

[b]Specs[/b]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/steamdeck]Steam Deck[/url]: AMD Zen 2 4c/8t 2.4-3.5GHz, 16 GB RAM, 8 AMD RDNA 2 CUs

[h1]Should you play this game?[/h1]
[i]If you enjoy stealth and cleaning, this game is for you.[/i]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]In-Depth Review[/h1]

[h3]Visuals[/h3]
[i]The WereCleaner[/i] uses 3D visuals, but they are deformed so much that they end up looking cute, especially the main character. Moreover, the environment is also made to match it. Despite the game showing blood and organs, the presentation doesn't make it look horrible because of this.

[h3]Story[/h3]
The story is mostly told in the form of dialogues that are shown in each level and cutscenes after a few levels. The former will be full of dialogue between you and the security guard who is guarding the office where you work. The latter will be done without dialogues‚Äîit will be done in the animation format without any text. The animation looks cute, and the dialogue isn't boring to read.

[h3]The Game[/h3]
[b]Gameplay[/b]
You are a janitor. Your job is to clean up messes. The game will place the location of the messes that you have to clean on the map, so you just need to go there, clean the mess, and exit the office. You are armed with two weapons at first: the vacuum will suck all trash, while the powerwasher will clean all the stains. The game spans seven levels of varying difficulty.

Well, you are also a werewolf. People don't like werewolves. You eat people since you can't control your instinct. The solution? Clean the messes without being seen. You need to avoid people looking at you‚Äîthe game has some leniency as long as you don't get too close, although since you need to go fast, sometimes it can be hard to react quickly if someone is looking at you in the direction you are walking.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3360664876 

Despite only being set in an office, each level still feels unique. The office was big, and the game made it so that you can only access a certain part of the office at the first few levels, and then start introducing new areas and/or incorporating them with old ones. You need to figure out where the area is that most people are going to and avoid going there if possible. Later on, there will be another way to help you not get seen, although the execution can be hard to do since you need to be close to them.

Killing people isn't the end. You'll get the option to move the body or eat it, which will require you to clean. Leaving the body as it is will be hard to do since people will find it and then go into panic. Moreover, eating the body can take a longer time since you also need to clean the mess, making it faster to just restart the game if you aim for a perfect score.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3256605529 

Each level will be graded. There are 5 stars and a no-kill mark. You can get both at the same run or do it separately‚Äîthey will only save your best progress. Getting five stars requires you to finish the level quickly, while the no-kill rule is exactly as it says. If this isn't enough, the game also has collectibles every few levels to amp the challenge.

[b]Length and Difficulty[/b]
I finished the game in 1.8h. I had to replay some levels several times to get five stars and no-kill in each level for some achievements. As for the difficulty, it is easy to beat if you don't mind the optional stuff, although the game will increase in difficulty if you try to get the five stars and no-kill mark.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[i]The WereCleaner[/i] is such a cute stealth game. The levels are enjoyable, and the gameplay is easy to learn. The game might be short, but there is still a lot of content in it. If you enjoy both stealth and cleaning games, this is the perfect game for you.

An absolute gem of a game. This game is simple whilst also engaging. The art style is cute and it does not take itself very seriously. So an absolute recommendation from my side.

[h2] The game [/h2]
The game itself does have a great gameplay loop and adds different things incrementally. So the learning curve was great.
The stealth with the speed of the character make it fun to play over and over just to get the stars/no kills.

But the game is quite short and fast to play through. Getting all the achievements is also not the hardest thing.

[h2] Polish [/h2]
This game is quite polished and the art does guide the player very well through the experience. This game feels finished and plays nicely. But I have some nitpicks in this department:
[olist]
   [*] The game shows the information that you have the ability to switch tools in the first level whilst not being able to switch.
   [*] A little point about performance that I am going to talk about in the "Performance" section.
   [*] At least for me, it seemed like the detection is a little bit variable. Sometimes they do not see you, even though they should have (and you are quite thankful) and sometimes they detect you instantly. And in this case I do not mean that when they are working, they do not really seem to detect you (except you are directly in their sight) but more or less that sometimes they detect you instantly around the corner and in other scenarios you can run in front of them, put a bag on them and then act like nothing happened.
   [*] You can easily get stuck at corners if you run near to the wall. This does [b]not[/b] happen very often as the spaces are large enough, but if it happens it is extremely annoying. Thankfully this is quite rare.
   [*] When the player is in the menu where you select the level, your selection is automatically placed on the "Home Menu" Button. And if you want to go to the first item you have to go right and cannot go to the bottom. This is just a tiny nitpick, but it annoyed me enough to be in this list.
[/olist]

But just to reiterate. These are just nitpicks and are nothing major. So this game is extremely polished and feels great.

[h2] Performance [/h2]
I myself didn't have any real performance issues. I have read in the forums about some people having extreme lags, but this wasn't the case on my devices and most people seem not to have any performance problems.
But it still seems like sometimes if you are in a level and something gets loaded, the game does not keep up with the framerate and gets a little bit stuttery. This is not problematic, but it was a little bit annoying.

But I have to note that this game ran smoothly 99% of the time and I never had any major performance problems.

[h2] TL;DR [/h2]
This game is amazing and that this game is free is another reason to get this game now. It does not take long to play trough and even though there are some small critiques, the game itself is fantastic.

Despite being very short, roughly taking 1-2 hours to play to completion, it finds a way to challenge you with each level. At no point does it feel like their is as huge challenge curve, rather increasing the amount of coworkers you may encounter at each turn. The length of each level is quite generous, with more than enough time for one to complete them, even if you end up eating a coworker or two to keep your cover.

In terms of the storytelling and attention to details, I must give the game devs props for keeping things humorous and cute. The art style definitely compliments the overall storytelling, which takes on a sateric and comedic take on minimum wage jobs, which in this case is a janitorial position. Despite being cursed as a werewolf he continues to work, despite putting his coworkers at risk of being his dinner just to pay rent.

Overall, this game deserves a quick play, and can be a great game night choice with a duo or with friends.

tl;dr -> Quircky and comedic game that is simplistic and easy to learn, challenge is curved but fair, great game to play with friends and is free to play!
